meanings.definition: The act of performing tasks typically associated with women.
meanings.sent1: She excelled in womanning the event, taking care of every detail.
meanings.sent2: Her womanning of the household chores was efficient and organized.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's secret power was womanning, ensuring everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the character's womanning of the situation brought harmony to chaos.
meanings.sent5: The art of womanning the project made her indispensable to the team.

meanings.definition: The state of being a woman.
meanings.sent1: Her confidence and grace reflected the essence of womanning.
meanings.sent2: The celebration of womanning was evident in the gathering of strong women.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show humorously portrayed the challenges of womanning in a male-dominated world.
meanings.sent4: She embraced the power of womanning, standing tall in her femininity.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured the beauty and strength of womanning through the ages.

meanings.sent1: The company decided to start womanning the new department to promote diversity.
meanings.sent2: She womanned the team with skilled and dedicated women.
meanings.sent3: The manager joked about womanning the office with all the talented ladies.
meanings.sent4: The organization is womanning the project with a diverse group of women.
meanings.sent5: She womans the committee with efficiency and inclusivity.
